text: London's Olympic Stadium The 2015 Race of Champions was a motorsports event that took place over 20–21 November 2015 at the Olympic Stadium in London. A previous six-time winner of the Nations' Cup, Sebastian Vettel became Champion of Champions for the first time, defeating Tom Kristensen, who made the final for the fourth time, 2–0. In the Nations' Cup itself, the England 1 team of Jason Plato and Andy Priaulx took the victory in a final race decider against Germany, who were represented by Vettel and fellow Formula One driver Nico Hülkenberg. ==Participants== The 2015 Race of Champions drivers {| class="wikitable" ! Nations' Cup team ! Drivers ! 2015 series |- |rowspan=2|All Stars | Romain Grosjean | Formula One |- | Chris Hoy | ELMS, Radical European Masters |- |rowspan=2| Americas | Ryan Hunter-Reay | IndyCar |- | José María López | World Touring Car Championship |- |rowspan=2| Australia | Daniel Ricciardo | Formula One |- | Mick Doohan | none |- |rowspan=2| Brazil | Felipe Massa | Formula One |- | Nelson Piquet Jr. | Global RallyCross, Formula E, Indy Lights |- |rowspan=2| England 1 | Jason Plato | BTCC |- | Andy Priaulx | BTCC, ELMS |- |rowspan=2| England 2 | Jenson Button | Formula One |- | Alex Buncombe | Blancpain Endurance Series |- |rowspan=2| Germany | Sebastian Vettel | Formula One |- | Nico Hülkenberg | Formula One, WEC |- |rowspan=2| Nordic | Tom Kristensen | none |- | Petter Solberg | World Rallycross Championship |- |rowspan=2| Scotland | David Coulthard | none |- | Susie Wolff | Formula One test and reserve driver |- |rowspan=2|Young Stars | Jolyon Palmer | Formula One test and reserve driver |- | Pascal Wehrlein | Deutsche Tourenwagen Masters |} ==Cars== Eight vehicles were used throughout the event. Returning from the 2014 Race of Champions were the Ariel Atom Cup, the KTM X-Bow, the ROC Car and the NASCAR Chevrolet SS Stock Car as used in the NASCAR Whelen Euro Series. Introduced for 2015 were the Mercedes-AMG GT, the Radical SR3 RSX and the Rage Comet, while the RX 150 returned after an absence of several years. ==Nations' Cup== ===Preliminary round=== {| class="wikitable" ! Team 1 ! Score !
